title: 110_s1276
content: The Methamphetamine Production Prevention Act of 2008 clarifies signature capture and retention for electronic methamphetamine precursor logbook systems under the Controlled Substances Act. The Methamphetamine Production Prevention Act of 2008 specifies requirements for electronic signature capture and retention in logbooks for methamphetamine precursor sales under the Controlled Substances Act. The Methamphetamine Production Prevention Act of 2008 mandates that electronic logbooks for methamphetamine precursor sales must preserve signatures linking them to other purchaser information. Bound paper books must include a sticker or unique identifier with product details, purchaser information, and sale date/time, signed by the purchaser. The purchaser must sign a printed document containing product details, purchaser information, and sale date/time. The signed document should be stored securely in a binder or other means of document storage. The seller records product name and quantity sold in a logbook, which can be done electronically. The logbook also includes purchaser's name, address, and sale date/time. The seller must verify purchaser-entered information in the logbook, while purchasers must verify seller-entered information. Electronic capture methods are allowed. The logbook includes a notice about criminal penalties for false information. The seller must maintain logbook entries for at least 2 years, with a notice of criminal penalties for false information.
